alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 01 at 3:20AM MST until March 03 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW TO IMPACT MOUNTAIN PASSES... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 7 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 14 inches in the mountains, including Lookout Pass. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 7 inches in the valleys. Ridgetop winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...St. Maries, Mullan, Fourth Of July Pass, Wallace, Osburn, Fernwood, Kellogg, Lookout Pass, Dobson Pass, and Pinehurst. * WHEN...From 4 AM Thursday to 7 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and snow covered. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes. Gusty ridge winds could cause result in blowing and drifting snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
